longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 3 months: 
 - for nationals of Colombia; 
Visa required, except for Holders of a valid "D" visa issued
by a Schengen Member State . 
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days for holders
of a multiple-entry  C  visa issued by a Schengen Member State
. The visa must be valid throughout the period of
stay. 
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days for holders
of a multiple entry visa issued by Canada or USA to nationals
of Colombia. The visa must be valid throughout the period of
stay. 
Minors:
- Unaccompanied minors under 18 years of age must
  
- Minors under 18 years of age accompanied by parents with a
  different surname  
Additional Information:
- On 10 October 2010, the Netherlands Antilles have been
  dissolved. Curacao continues as an independent country
  within the Kingdom of the Netherlands. 
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents required for their next
  destination. 
- Extension of stay is possible.
- Holders of a visa issued by Canada, USA or a Schengen Member
  State are granted a max. stay of 90 days within one calendar
  year in the Kingdom of the Netherlands in the Caribbean
  (Aruba, Curacao, Bonaire, St. Eustasius and Saba, St.
  Maarten).
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward ticket could be refused
  entry
